alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Powell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 7:07PM EDT until August 06 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Kentucky, including the following counties, Menifee, Montgomery and Powell. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 706 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Excssive runoff will cause minor flooding of small streams and creeks, roads, and roadside culverts. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Stanton, Frenchburg, Jeffersonville, Clay City, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Cat Creek, Rosslyn, Bowen, Means, Bean, Cedar Groves, Fagan, Cornwell, Rothwell, Haystack, Waltersville, Tabor, Powell Valley, Virden and Westbend.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
